intro: Symphoricarpos utahensis, commonly known as Utah buffaloberry, is a shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its small, red berries that are edible for both humans and wildlife. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky areas and has dark green, oval-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of white flowers in the spring, which are followed by the distinctive orange-red berries in the fall. The plant is adapted to arid environments and plays an important role in local ecosystems.
